meanings.definition: A physical phenomenon produced by the motion of electric charge, resulting in attractive and repulsive forces between objects.
meanings.sent1: The magnetism of the two magnets pulled them together.
meanings.sent2: The fridge door's magnetism kept it closed.
meanings.sent3: The magnetism between the socks in the laundry made them stick together.
meanings.sent4: The magnetism of her personality drew people towards her.
meanings.sent5: The magnetism of the north pole guides compass needles.

meanings.definition: The ability of an object to attract iron or steel.
meanings.sent1: The magnetism of the horseshoe magnet picked up the paperclips.
meanings.sent2: The magnetism of the earth's core affects the magnetic field.
meanings.sent3: The magnetism of the fridge magnet made it the hero of the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The magnetism of the rock star drew fans from all over the world.
meanings.sent5: The magnetism of the metal beam pulled the crane towards it.
